metadata.title: CVE-2018-10927 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in RPC request using gfs3_lookup_req in glusterfs server.An authenticated attacker could use this flaw to leak information andexecute remote denial of service by crashing gluster brick process.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10927` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-common - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-server - 4.1.4-1
libgfapi0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfchangelog0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfrpc0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfxdr0 - 4.1.4-1
libglusterfs0 - 4.1.4-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.4-1').
